intro: Sasaella cappattama, commonly known as the mountain bamboo, is a perennial grass-like plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its slender,丛生 (clumping) growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. Due to its resilience and adaptability, it plays an important ecological role in stabilizing mountainous soils.
